decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressively building a board presence early with cards like Mosswood Dreadknight, Caustic Bronco, and Preacher of the Schism. It also utilizes cards like Cut Down and Go for the Throat to control the opponent's board. The inclusion of Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse allows for graveyard shenanigans and potential card advantage. Liliana of the Veil provides both disruption and card advantage. The deck aims to apply constant pressure to the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells, supported by cards like Long Goodbye and Cut Down to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Gix, Yawgmoth Praetor and Phyrexian Fleshgorger provide a strong creature base, while Liliana of the Veil and Mirrex help control the board. The deck aims to quickly close out games with Evolved Sleeper and other strong creatures like Harvester of Misery and Archfiend of the Dross. Mishra's Foundry and Caustic Bronco provide additional utility, making this Mono Black Aggro deck a formidable force in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of the deck is to aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful removal spells. By utilizing a mix of low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and Sanguine Evangelist, along with higher impact cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Gleeful Demolition, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Cavern of Souls and Inspiring Vantage help to ensure smooth mana development, while cards like Knight-Errant of Eos and Imodane's Recruiter provide additional utility and card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence with aggressive creatures like Mosswood Dreadknight, Phyrexian Fleshgorger, and Caustic Bronco. It also includes removal spells like Go for the Throat and Gix's Command to clear the way for attacks. The inclusion of cards like Nissa, Ascended Animist and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provide additional value and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of creature aggression and disruption, utilizing Golgari colors for a strong mix of creature power and removal spells.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming opponents with a swarm of small, aggressive creatures, backed up by removal spells like Destroy Evil and Charge of the Mites. The deck utilizes cards like Venerated Rotpriest and Annex Sentry to buff up the creatures on board, while also incorporating cards like Crawling Chorus and Slaughter Singer for additional damage output. The inclusion of cards like Thran Portal and Mirrex helps to maintain card advantage and provide additional utility. The overall strategy revolves around quick and efficient aggression to quickly overpower opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures backed up by efficient removal spells. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total by playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cunning Coyote, while also using direct damage spells like Shock and Lightning Strike to control the board. The deck also includes creatures with powerful abilities like Witchstalker Frenzy and Voldaren Thrillseeker to further pressure the opponent. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining a fast and relentless pace to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with low-cost creatures and using them to apply pressure and control the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Knight-Errant of Eos and Resolute Reinforcements, the deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they have time to react. Cards like Aven Interrupter and Phantom Interference provide additional disruption and control options, allowing the deck to dictate the pace of the game and maintain its aggressive strategy throughout.
